intro: Alsine edwardsii, commonly known as Edwards' sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to the western United States. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xerophytic habitats.
